Recently, I got this email:
 -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Recently Marines over in Iraq supporting this country in OIF wrote to 
 Starbucks because they wanted to let them know how much they liked 
 their coffee and try to score some free coffee grounds. Starbucks wrote 
 back telling the Marines thanks for their support in their business, 
 but that they don't support the War and anyone in it and that they 
 won't send them the Coffee. So as not to offend them we should not 
 support in buying any Starbucks products. As a War vet and writing to 
 you patriots I feel we should get this out in the open. I know this War 
 might not be very popular with some folks, but that doesn't mean we 
 don't support the boys on the ground fighting street to street and house 
 to house for what they and I believe is right. If you feel the same as 
 I do then pass this along, or you can discard it and I'll never know. 
 Thanks very much for your support to me, and I know you'll all be there 
 again here soon when I deploy once more. 
 
 Semper Fidelis, 
 
 Sgt Howard C. Wright 
 1st Force Recon Co 
 1st Plt PLT RTO 
 
 Jackson Davis
 Great Plains Direct, Inc.
 voice (913) 492-1237
 fax (913) 492-8650 
 -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
 Is this true? Can anybody vouch for this?
 I emailed Starbucks to get a verification, but I highly doubt I'll get a reply.
 I can't believe that Starbucks would (a) be heartless toward soldiers that just want a taste of home, something to comfort them in war (b) would try to make some political statement by withholding their precious coffee from someone. It's not THAT great. 
 
 Well, If anyone can tell me the veracity of this story, please do.
 If I get a response from Starbucks I'll put it up here (if I remember).
 
 .
A brilliant strategy by Starbucks competition.

Debunked 
 That is a false email... click on the debunked link :)

In my local starbucks there is a sign asking people to buy a pound of coffee to send to the soldiers in the ME. Apparently they are going to ship it all out the first week of november (if I remember correctly). 
 
 Don't believe everything you read.

Ah! Good. I thought it might be a load. Maybe someone had a beef with Starbucks. OR I got this email after a lot of people had already complained to Starbucks. O well.
 
 .
Leave Starbucks alone... they might be a chain of clone-cafes but they do a really good apple and cinnamon muffin :p
Here is something interesting about Starbuck's www.revbilly.com

Here is something interesting about Starbuck's www.revbilly.com

 
 Alternatively, read "No Logo" by Naomi Klein, if you want to know what's wrong with Starbucks
